title: How BoldTrail Leads Help eXp Agents Fill Their Pipeline
excerpt: Key Takeaway:  BoldTrail gives eXp agents four Marketplace lead systems that plug straight into your Smart CRM: Property Boost, Leads 360 Buyer, Nosy Neighbor, and…
content:
Key Takeaway:  BoldTrail gives eXp agents four Marketplace lead systems that plug straight into your Smart CRM: Property Boost, Leads 360 Buyer, Nosy Neighbor, and Smart Social Leads. Each trades money for time in a different way. The right choice depends on whether you want buyers, sellers, or a steady mix, and how much follow up you will actually do.

TL;DR About BoldTrail Leads For eXp Agents

  • BoldTrail is one of eXp’s CRM choices with built in lead gen. 
  • Leads 360 Buyer combines Google PPC, social ads, and concierge follow up. 
  • Nosy Neighbor automates listing based farming for seller leads in exclusive zips. 
  • Smart Social Leads runs Meta carousel ads that feed buyers into BoldTrail. 
  • Boldtrail provides leads and the automation to go with them.

This guide explains BoldTrail leads for eXp agents, how Smart Social Leads, Leads 360 Buyer, and Nosy Neighbor work in real life, and where these BoldTrail Marketplace options fit inside eXp Realty lead generation as a whole.

eXp Realty is different for a lot of reasons, but for most agents the real advantage comes down to one thing, leads. Unlike other brokerages that tell you to “work your sphere” and hope for the best, eXp built multiple lead engines directly into the platform. Revenos is a full-time division focused on generating referral-quality leads for agents. Zoocasa delivers warm, vetted clients ready for conversations. Together, these programs form the core of eXp Realty lead generation, and BoldTrail leads for eXp agents are one of the easiest ways to tap into that system.

BoldTrail adds even more opportunities. If you choose BoldTrail as your free included eXp CRM, you get a full IDX website that captures search traffic right on your domain. Any visitor who looks at properties becomes a lead, and BoldTrail automates your alerts and follow-up so clients feel your presence even while you are doing something else. Your website also connects to unlimited landing pages, giving you additional free lead capture tools you can deploy in minutes.

BoldTrail also helps you sell listings faster with Property Boost, a simple promotion tool that turns your listing into a targeted ad with built-in lead capture. It creates exposure for the seller and new inquiries for you without requiring technical skills or ad management.

This blog focuses on the three inexpensive paid lead paths inside BoldTrail that most agents overlook. They are ready to turn on, simple to manage, and designed to create predictable leads. The paid leads options are Smart Social Leads, Leads 360 Buyer, and Nosy Neighbor. Each one follows the rule every agent already knows. You either pay with your time, or you pay with your money, or most likely, both. The difference is that BoldTrail gives you leverage, better targeting, and a shorter road between new lead and real pipeline.

Table of Contents

BoldTrail Lead Systems At A Glance
Smart Social Leads For Buyer Focused eXp Agents
Leads 360 Buyer For eXp Agents
Nosy Neighbor For Listing Focused eXp Agents
What Agents Also Ask About BoldTrail Leads For eXp Realty
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions About BoldTrail And eXp

BoldTrail Lead Systems At A Glance

BoldTrail is the next generation version of kvCORE, a smart CRM and lead engine that eXp offers as one of its CRM choices. Inside the BoldTrail Marketplace, eXp agents can buy three main paid lead systems that plug straight into the BoldTrail Smart CRM. These BoldTrail lead programs are a simple way for eXp agents to add predictable real estate agent leads on top of their organic efforts.

And, to be sure, BoldTrail is built to be an end to end platform. It runs your IDX site, your Smart CRM, and your paid lead generation in one place. Being able to pick BoldTrail when you join eXp matters if you want tight integration between ads, follow up, and your pipeline. 

BoldTrail’s Marketplace has three core ways to “just buy more leads” instead of trying to out design Meta’s ad manager on a Sunday night. Here’s what BoldTrail offers in a nutshell:

  • Smart Social Leads runs dynamic listing carousels on Facebook and Instagram that pull from your brokerage and MLS, retarget visitors, and drop paid buyer leads into your Smart CRM with the hashtag and source already tagged. 
  • Leads 360 Buyer wraps Google PPC, Meta buyer ads, and a concierge follow up team called Success Assurance. It is a full top of funnel system for buyers who are earlier in the journey. 
  • Nosy Neighbor is a listing farm in a box. It sends Just Listed and Just Sold postcards with QR codes, routes neighbors to a home value landing page, then pushes warm homeowners into BoldTrail as seller prospects. 

So, how do you work the leads you get?  NAR’s marketing guidance is clear. Online leads work when you combine consistent advertising with fast, structured follow up, not when you wait three days to call. BoldTrail exists to close that gap so you are not chasing spreadsheets and scrolling your phone to remember who you forgot.

Think of Boldtrail as choosing between three different factory lines for leads, instead of trying to assemble each one on your kitchen table.

Smart Social Leads For Buyer Focused eXp Agents

Smart Social Leads is BoldTrail’s Meta buyer ad program. It runs dynamic carousel ads of local listings on Facebook and Instagram, then retargets people who click or visit your site. Plans start around $250 per month and send new buyer leads straight into BoldTrail as tagged contacts with phone, email, and source already attached. I

Smart Social Leads focuses on one thing. Keep your database growing with fresh buyers every month. Inside Real Estate pulls listings from your brokerage first, then backfills with MLS data, and builds a rotating carousel of homes that match your chosen target areas. 

The platform spins up ten to fifteen ad variations at once so Meta’s algorithm can learn which copy and images convert best. That keeps your cost per lead in check and gives you more total contacts for the budget. Every lead captured through Facebook’s native form is pushed into BoldTrail with a buyer specific hashtag and lead source label. 

For eXp agents, Smart Social Leads is often the entry level paid option. It works best when you:

  • Have clear follow up plans for new buyer registrations.
  • Use BoldTrail Smart Campaigns for day one nurture, then add calls and texts. 
  • Pair your paid ads with organic content so leads see you in more than one place.

Smart Social Leads is for the agent who understands that Facebook is already showing buyers houses, so it might as well be you showing the houses.

Leads 360 Buyer For eXp Agents

Leads 360 Buyer is BoldTrail’s bundled buyer lead system that combines Google PPC, Meta ads, and Success Assurance concierge follow up. Pricing ranges roughly from $450 to $1,100 dollars, depending on your market and budget. It is built for eXp agents who want a done with you buyer pipeline tied straight into BoldTrail. 

Leads 360 Buyer sits at the top of the BoldTrail paid stack. You are not just buying clicks, you are buying a strategy. Inside Real Estate’s team manages refined Google search campaigns to catch buyers who are actively hunting for homes, then layers Facebook and Instagram buyer ads on top. 

The Success Assurance concierge team then works those leads by call and text. Their job is to respond fast, ask basic qualifying questions, and hand you “conversation ready” prospects instead of raw, cold registrations. 

For an eXp agent who has more money than time, Leads 360 Buyer can be the “pay with dollars” option. You will still have to:

  • Set a monthly budget you can commit to for at least six to twelve months.
  • Accept that not every lead is ready now, most are mid to long term.
  • Build tight systems inside BoldTrail for tasks, Smart Campaigns, and calls.

The upside is scale. One well run Leads 360 Buyer campaign can keep your BoldTrail dashboard full of new conversations so you are not stuck waiting on open house walk ins.

Leads 360 Buyer is for the agent who would rather needs lots of caffeine due to all the needed follow up than keep refreshing their email hoping a buyer magically appears.

Nosy Neighbor For Listing Focused eXp Agents

Nosy Neighbor is BoldTrail’s listing farm system that gives you exclusive rights to specific zip codes. Pricing starts around $749 per month per zip. The service attracts seller leads, then funnels those who respond into a home value landing page and your BoldTrail Smart CRM as seller prospects. 

Every listing attracts curious neighbors. Nosy Neighbor automates that curiosity instead of wasting it. When a property in your reserved zip code lists or sells, the system pulls MLS data, finds nearby homeowners through public records, and mails up to roughly 500 postcards per zip each month. 

Each postcard has your photo, branding, and a QR code. When a homeowner scans, they land on a branded page that asks them to guess the sale price, then invites them to request a free home value estimate. They must consent to follow up before their information pushes into BoldTrail. 

From there, BoldTrail assigns a seller Smart Campaign, market reports, and property alerts. Your job is to:

  • Call quickly with a simple, human script.
  • Offer a clear value hook, like a “List Power Analysis” instead of a vague CMA.
  • Keep light touch follow up going for months, not days. 

Nosy Neighbor fits eXp agents who want listings, are willing to work a geographic farm, and like seeing a map full of dots that slowly turn into real conversations. It is also friendly for teams who want junior agents to handle nurtures while rainmakers take listing appointments.

Think of Nosy Neighbor as sending a polite spy into every mailbox so you can stop guessing which “nosy” homeowner is finally ready to talk.

What Agents Also Ask About BoldTrail Leads For eXp Realty

Do BoldTrail leads for eXp agents come with exclusivity?
Leads 360 Buyer and Smart Social Leads typically do not promise strict territory exclusivity, so other agents can also run campaigns in your area. Nosy Neighbor is different. It sells exclusive zip codes which makes its BoldTrail seller leads closer to a protected farm than a shared buyer pool. 

How long before BoldTrail paid leads start turning into closings?
With BoldTrail paid leads, you should plan for a six to twelve month horizon before you judge the program. Many internet leads have longer timelines, so your BoldTrail Smart Campaigns and calling habits matter as much as the source. Consistency, not one good month, is what turns BoldTrail leads into income. 

Which BoldTrail lead system is best for a new eXp agent?
New eXp agents on BoldTrail often start with Smart Social Leads, since the price point is lower and the focus is buyer leads that are easier to convert early. Nosy Neighbor and Leads 360 Buyer work better once you have scripts, time blocking, and a steady follow up rhythm dialed in. 

Do I still need other lead pillars if I am paying for BoldTrail leads?
Yes. NAR research keeps showing that the healthiest businesses blend online leads with sphere, referrals, and local marketing. BoldTrail leads should be one pillar, not the only pillar. When you join Smart Agent Alliance, we help you decide where BoldTrail fits in your bigger picture so it does not become your only plan.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

To see how Boldtrail leads fit alongside Making It Rain eXp Realty PPC leads, Zoocasa, Revenos, and My Link My Leads, be sure to review our main eXp Realty leads pillar article. Boldtrail is one piece of a larger lead ecosystem, not a stand-alone silver bullet.

When you join eXp Realty, you choose both a brokerage and a sponsor team. Your choice of CRM, including BoldTrail, also shapes how you will handle eXp Realty lead generation day to day, especially if you plan to lean on BoldTrail leads for eXp agents as a core pillar.

Sponsor Smart Agent Alliance sits directly inside the Wolf Pack upline, which means when you name us as your eXp sponsor you get two teams for the price of zero. 

Here is what you get from Smart Agent Alliance:

  1. Social Agent Academy Pro – 997 dollars per year value, included
    Modern social media and content training built with Mike Sherrard so you can layer organic attraction on top of your BoldTrail leads.
  2. AI Agent Accelerator – 697 dollars value, included
    AI workflows, prompts, and templates that help you respond faster, write better follow up, and keep BoldTrail tasks from piling up.
  3. Client Pipeline Accelerator – 2,497 dollars value, included
    Systems for building multiple lead pillars, so Leads 360 Buyer or Smart Social Leads become one channel, not your entire business.
  4. Top Agent Live Masterminds – not for sale, included
    Weekly live calls with Smart Agent Alliance and Wolf Pack leaders where we break down what is working now with BoldTrail, Zoocasa, Revenos, and more. 
  5. Done For You Passive Income System – 2,363 to 10,000 plus dollars per year, included
    Custom revenue share pages, webinars, one on one calls, and nurture campaigns so your lead gen effort also supports long term wealth, not just today’s buyers and sellers.
  6. Brand New Agent Accelerator – 497 dollars value, included
    Onboarding checklists, scripts, and time blocking plans that show new agents exactly how to work BoldTrail leads while they are still learning the rest of the business.

? Total value: over 7,000 dollars per year, all free when you join Smart Agent Alliance as your eXp Realty sponsor. Full details live on our main sponsor page. 

You can read more about how we support experienced agents who join eXp on our pillar article for experienced agents, our deep dive on what eXp sponsors actually do, and our breakdown of the sponsor program rules, all live on Smart Agent Alliance. 

Frequently Asked Questions About BoldTrail And eXp

Do eXp agents get BoldTrail leads for free?

No. eXp agents can choose BoldTrail for free as a CRM under the CRM of choice program. The BoldTrail Marketplace lead products, like Leads 360 Buyer, Nosy Neighbor, and Smart Social Leads, are optional paid add ons with separate monthly pricing. 

Are BoldTrail Marketplace leads exclusive to one agent?

Leads 360 Buyer and Smart Social Leads do not typically provide exclusive rights to all leads in an area, since they use search and social ads that multiple agents can run. Nosy Neighbor does offer exclusive zip codes for its postcard driven seller leads, so only one agent holds each active zip at a time. 

Can I run Leads 360 Buyer, Nosy Neighbor, and Smart Social Leads together?

Yes. Many agents stack BoldTrail lead systems so they have multiple lead types. For example, a listing focused agent might combine Nosy Neighbor for sellers with Smart Social Leads for buyers. The key is having enough budget and time to follow up properly on the extra volume you create. 

Who owns the contacts generated from BoldTrail lead programs?

The leads generated through BoldTrail programs are added directly to your BoldTrail Smart CRM with tags and sources that trace back to the program. You are responsible for working those contacts, maintaining compliance with local laws, and deciding how to nurture them over time.

How fast should I respond to new BoldTrail leads?

For best results, treat BoldTrail leads like any other online lead source. Industry guidance from NAR and lead conversion studies suggests responding within minutes, not hours, and using structured follow up over the first days and weeks. BoldTrail Smart Campaigns help, but live calls from you still matter.

Do I have to use BoldTrail if I join eXp Realty?

No. eXp’s CRM of choice program lets agents pick from several approved CRMs. BoldTrail is designed for agents who want an all in one solution with integrated websites and paid lead options. Check out which platform might work for you best by viewing this BoldTrail, Lofty, or Cloze CRM choice.

How does BoldTrail fit into eXp Realty lead generation for agents?

BoldTrail fits into eXp Realty lead generation as the all in one CRM plus paid lead engine for eXp agents who choose it. Your BoldTrail Smart CRM powers your IDX website, landing pages, and campaigns. BoldTrail Marketplace options like Smart Social Leads, Leads 360 Buyer, and Nosy Neighbor then layer in paid real estate agent leads so you can build a mix of organic and purchased opportunities in one system.

title: Zoocasa: Hot Leads Only Available at eXp Realty
excerpt: Key Takeaway: With Zoocasa, you gain proprietary Zoocasa lead generation, a full tech stack, and coaching built by Zoocasa so you hit your first deals…
content:
Key Takeaway: With Zoocasa, you gain proprietary Zoocasa lead generation, a full tech stack, and coaching built by Zoocasa so you hit your first deals faster than going it alone. Zoocasa is the flagship automated leads eXp Realty program for newer agents who want warm leads instead of cold prospecting.

TL;DR About Zoocasa

  • Smart Agent Alliance sponsorship gives you access to Zoocasa’s lead engine and eXp Realty platform.
  • You’ll benefit from warm, pre-qualified leads, robust tech, and step-by-step coaching.
  • Proven results 
  • Ideal for newer agents or solo producers who want structure

This guide is your complete overview of Zoocasa for eXp agents, including what Zoocasa is, how the Zoocasa Agent Accelerator works, what kind of Zoocasa lead generation you can expect, and which agents get the most benefit.

Most agents know eXp Realty for its cloud platform, global footprint, low fees, and the ability to earn from more than just closings. What they likely don’t hear is that eXp also invests heavily in lead generation. Revenos is part of that system, delivering leads to agents who already have a year or more of production behind them.

That leaves a natural question. Where do the new agents go? The ones who need leads now, not “someday”? That is where Zoocasa comes in. Zoocasa gives newer or non-producing agents warm leads, accountability, and coaching so they can ramp up fast instead of waiting for their pipeline to appear. In simple terms, Zoocasa is eXp Realty’s in house lead generation program for new real estate agents, combining Zoocasa Agent Accelerator, coaching, and warm online leads so you do not start your business from zero.

To be clear, eXp also offers simple ways for agents to pay upfront and generate their own lead flow. This blog is about a different path, a subsidiary of eXp that handles the advertising for you, provides the coaching to convert those leads, and does it with no upfront cost.

Table of Contents

What Zoocasa Actually Is and Why It Exists at eXp Realty
Zoocasa’s Proven Results: Agents Win Faster
What Agents Get With Zoocasa
How Zoocasa’s Agent Accelerator Program Works

Acceptance Criteria
Agent Splits

What Zoocasa Actually Is and Why It Exists at eXp Realty

Zoocasa is a property-tech company and lead-generation engine that became a wholly-owned subsidiary of eXp Realty in 2022, designed to give eXp agents exclusive coaching and access to high-quality, pre-qualified online leads and market data. In other words, Zoocasa eXp Realty is the parent child relationship where eXp owns the Zoocasa platform, and Zoocasa focuses on generating and converting online leads for eXp Realty agents.

When eXp acquired Zoocasa, they weren’t just buying another portal; they were buying an engine. Zoocasa had already developed consumer-facing search tools, deep listing data, and a lead-qualification system that weeded out low intent consumers. By bringing Zoocasa into the eXp fold, eXp Realty gained both “warmed up” leads for agents and the training that matters. Zoocasa’s program is called Agent Accelerator. This program matters if you want to build a career faster.

Zoocasa’s Proven Results: Agents Win Faster

Zoocasa agents outperform solo agents because they work inside a system built to produce results. They convert at higher rates, grow faster, and stay longer. Here’s what happens when an agent steps into Zoocasa’s structure instead of trying to build everything alone. These are not estimates. These are real averages pulled directly from program performance.

  • 2.5 times higher success rates than agents operating on their own.
  • 4 times faster growth than the industry average.
  • 90 percent retention because agents stay where they close deals and feel supported.
  • 52 days to the first client under contract on average.
  • 89 days to the first check in the agent’s bank account.
  • 20 deals in 18 months on average, something most agents don’t reach without a structured system that feeds them consistent opportunities.

Why does this work? Because Zoocasa removes the two biggest obstacles in real estate: weak pipelines and inconsistent execution. You do not start your career cold calling strangers hoping to land your first appointment. Instead, you enter a predictable cycle of pre-qualified leads, daily coaching, inside sales support, and clear conversion steps. You are not guessing. You are executing.

By the time you hit your twentieth deal, you have a growing sphere, a fully active pipeline, and repeat clients beginning to roll in. At that point the numbers start compounding, and you graduate with a business that would have taken years to build alone.

It is the closest thing real estate has to switching on a cheat code, only this time no one yells at you for using it.

What Agents Get With Zoocasa

Zoocasa sets you up with a lead machine that actually delivers clients. You plug in, follow the plan, and start moving toward real production instead of waiting for luck.

  • Warm leads: Rather than cold-call lists, you receive inbound prospects who have already engaged Zoocasa’s portal and staff.
  • Included top-tier tech stack including Follow Up Boss CRM, Shilo.ai, Buildify & Sisu.
  • Structure and accountability: 20 minute daily coaching calls for 2 weeks, then bi-monthly coaching check-ins
  • No upfront or monthly fees: Unlike paying upfront for lead services, Zoocasa’s cost is embedded in the model.
  • Work Zoocasa leads & Your Own and earn eXp’s 80/20 split for your own deals.
  • Skool platform learning hub with training modules, call replays, resources, and community discussions.
  • Quit anytime: If your plan changes, you can easily exit the program.

With Zoocasa you spend more time talking to real clients and less time wondering where they are. It feels like stepping into a kitchen where the ingredients are already prepped, labeled, and ready to cook. You still make the meal, you just start a lot closer to the finish line.

How Zoocasa’s Agent Accelerator Program Works

Zoocasa’s Agent Accelerator program gives you a structured path to real production, with clear expectations, transparent splits, and a predictable timeline for hitting your first twenty deals. Agents must be accepted into the program, which keeps lead flow high and the environment focused on results.

When you join Zoocasa Agent Accelerator at eXp Realty, you are not buying random leads, you are stepping into a complete Zoocasa lead generation and conversion system.

Acceptance Criteria

Getting accepted into Zoocasa’s Accelerator is straightforward and designed to set you up for success.

Here is what the process looks like:

  • Attend three short info sessions (each under one hour).
  • Complete simple homework to show coachability.
  • Confirm Zoocasa has enough lead flow in your area.
  • Do a brief interview so both sides can confirm the fit.

Even if you are not accepted, you walk away with several hours of meaningful conversion training you can use immediately. If you are accepted, you step into a launchpad that gets you into real conversations faster than trying to build everything alone. Join the next Zoocasa info sessions, Click here to get started with Zoocasa.

Agent Splits

Your split inside the Accelerator is designed to reflect the support, coaching, and pre-qualified leads you are receiving.

During Accelerator (first 20 Zoocasa deals):

  • 45 percent to the agent
  • 55 percent to Zoocasa which already includes eXp’s 20 percent
  • This covers Zoocasa’s national advertising, paid traffic, inside sales team, lead qualification, and coaching.
  • Because eXp’s 20 percent is already included in the 45 percent agent split, your payout is higher than a 55 percent agent split on an eXp production team, where the agent still pays eXp’s 20 percent on top.

After 20 Zoocasa deals (Partner level):

  • 65 percent to the agent
  • 35 percent to Zoocasa
    • At this stage you typically have an active pipeline and stronger skills.

Important Notes

Your own sphere and self-generated transactions always close at your standard eXp 80/20 split, completely separate from Zoocasa. One tradeoff to be aware of is that agents do not cap while in Zoocasa programs.

If Zoocasa’s Agent Accelerator splits seem steep at first glance, remember that 45 percent of consistent closings that already includes eXp’s 20 percent is far better than 80 percent of almost no closings. Plus, you graduate with a healthy pipeline for future deals, real skills, and momentum you can build on for years. 

Besides leads, what is included for free when you’re part of Zoocasa?
Agents receive a full suite of tools, training, and support valued at $97,384 per year, all included with no upfront cost.

Here is the breakdown:

  • Shilo AI valued at $6,584 per year
  • Follow Up Boss valued at $4,992 per year
  • Buildify valued at $5,988 per year
  • Sisu Premiere valued at $1,188 per year
  • Skool learning and community platform valued at $1,632 per year
  • One on one coaching valued at $9,600 per year
  • Pre-qualified leads valued at $14,400 per year
  • Dedicated inside sales representative valued at $53,000 per year

All combined, Zoocasa agents receive $97,384 in annual value without paying monthly fees or buying leads out of pocket.

Who Zoocasa Is Best For 

Zoocasa is ideal for agents who want structure, pipeline help, and a proven real estate lead program rather than guessing their way through new real estate agent lead generation. Zoocasa is less suited for agents in real estate productions teams and experienced top-producers who already have leads and systems.

Best fit:

  • New agents who have minimal or no transaction history and need a program to accelerate deals quickly.
  • Solo agents switching from a small brokerage who want a plug-and-play funnel rather than build from scratch.
  • Agents who respond well to mentorship, daily tracking and an accountability structure.

Zoocasa gets you past the hardest part of a successful real estate career: getting and working leads. If you prefer a GPS instead of wandering the wilderness, this is your trail map.

What Agents Also Ask About Zoocasa

Is Zoocasa worth it for new eXp agents?
Yes. For agents new to eXp Realty the Zoocasa pipeline offers immediate access to inbound leads and coaching support that dramatically improve ramp-speed compared to building your own system from scratch.

How many leads do Zoocasa agents actually get?
Lead volume varies by market, but because Zoocasa operates a national portal and inside sales team, agents gain access to a higher-tier pool of online prospects rather than simple geographic farming lists. If lead volume is low in your area, Zoocasa is upfront about it and will not accept agents in that scenario.

What type of leads does Zoocasa provide? 

Agents receive mostly buyer leads, but some seller ones too. It depends on market activity in the agent’s location.

Are new agents also in the eXp Mentor program?

Yes, until the new agent meets the eXp Mentor graduation needs and has completed 3 deals that meet the Mentor program’s criteria.

Do I still get my eXp split on my own deals?
Yes. If you source a transaction independently of the Zoocasa funnel, you retain your full eXp split per your agreement. Zoocasa only applies to leads supplied through the program. However, you don’t cap while part of Zoocasa.

What happens after Zoocasa’s Agent Accelerator program?
After you hit 20 deals done, you transition into the full partner path with an increased split. Or, leave the program, now with a full pipeline and resume being solo at eXp Realty with eXp’s higher splits and ability to cap.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

To see how Zoocasa leads fit alongside Making It Rain eXp Realty PPC leads, Revenos, and BoldTrail, review our main eXp Realty leads pillar article. Zoocasa is one piece of a larger lead ecosystem, not a stand-alone silver bullet

Choosing the right sponsor when you join eXp has long-term implications, not just for your split, but your funnel, structure and growth curve. Through the Smart Agent Alliance dual-sponsor ecosystem (SAA + Wolf Pack) you get access to a full suite of value bundles:

  • Social Agent Academy Pro included ($997/year)
  • AI Agent Accelerator included ($697)
  • Client Pipeline Accelerator included ($2,497)
  • Top Agent Live Masterminds included (not for sale)
  • Done-For-You Passive Income System included (custom page, webinars, 1-on-1 calls, nurture campaigns) valued at $2,363–$10,000+/year
  • Brand New Agent Accelerator included ($497)
    ? Total value: $7,000+/year, all free with Smart Agent Alliance sponsorship.

If you join eXp without understanding funnel access, coaching and structure, you may end up piecing things together solo. With Zoocasa under Smart Agent Alliance you start ahead of the pack. It’s less “choose your broker and hope for the best” and more “choose your launchpad, strap in, and blast off.”

Curious how this stacks up to what you’re currently getting (or not getting)? Check out our eXp Commission and Fees Calculator. To learn more about our team visit our team value page.

Frequently Asked Questions

How does Zoocasa work with eXp Realty for lead generation?

Zoocasa is a wholly owned subsidiary of eXp Realty that runs a national portal, inside sales team, and the Zoocasa Agent Accelerator program. It generates and qualifies online leads, then routes those warm prospects to participating eXp agents. In practice, Zoocasa becomes a done for you Zoocasa lead generation system that plugs directly into your eXp Realty business.

Is Zoocasa considered paid leads for Realtors or a different model?

Zoocasa leads are not traditional pay per lead services where you swipe a card every month. Instead, Zoocasa lead generation is built into the Zoocasa Agent Accelerator model. You pay through the structured split on Zoocasa deals while keeping your standard eXp split on your own business. For many newer agents this feels safer than signing up for expensive paid leads for Realtors with no support.

What is the cost to join Zoocasa through eXp Realty?

There is no separate monthly fee for Zoocasa. Your standard eXp split applies to your own deals and you access the Zoocasa deal funnel and coaching without upfront lead-purchase commitments.

Can I opt out of Zoocasa and just join eXp normally?

Yes, you can join Zoocasa and later leave to work under eXp Realty with your cap back in place.

Are the leads exclusive to me?

Leads supplied through Zoocasa via the Accelerator are assigned; you’ll receive qualified prospects that haven’t yet engaged your competitor. There is still work to convert them, but you are not starting from cold.

What happens if I don’t hit deal #20 in 18 months?

If you don’t hit the milestone, you continue in the Accelerator with your coach. The timeline is a target not a hard cap; your split and access remain. The goal is to support you until you reach full partner status.

title: Should Realtors Rent Leads or Own Their Pipeline?
excerpt: Key Takeaway: The choice between renting leads and owning your pipeline determines whether you build a sustainable business or a temporary income stream. Rented leads…
content:
Key Takeaway: The choice between renting leads and owning your pipeline determines whether you build a sustainable business or a temporary income stream. Rented leads create dependency, while owned databases produce long-term growth, 10x higher conversions, and lasting business value that compounds over time.

TL;DR About Lead Ownership vs Renting

  • Purchased leads often cost agents $2,000–$10,000 monthly
  • Owned pipelines convert up to 10x higher
  • Lead flow ends the moment payments stop
  • Smart Agent Alliance gives free pipeline systems
  • Database ownership builds equity in your business

If you’ve been shelling out thousands each month for Zillow, Realtor.com, or “exclusive” Facebook leads that ghost you faster than your ex after a bad showing, welcome to the club. The average agent rents leads like they rent an apartment: high monthly cost, zero equity, and no control when the lease ends.

Meanwhile, the agents who own their pipelines are quietly building assets that keep producing deals year after year without buying another lead. The difference isn’t just strategy; it’s ownership. Owning your database is the business equivalent of owning your home. You build value with every relationship, every system, and every referral.

Table of Contents

The Problem With Renting Real Estate Leads
The Value of Owning Your Pipeline
How eXp Realty Supports Pipeline Ownership
The Payoff: Freedom from Lead Dependency
What Agents Also Ask About Lead Generation
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

The Problem With Renting Real Estate Leads

Renting real estate leads means paying ongoing fees for temporary access to prospects that multiple agents contact simultaneously. Once payments stop, lead flow ends, leaving agents with no lasting database or business asset.

The problem with renting leads isn’t just the high cost; it’s the lack of control. You’re building someone else’s business while draining your own profit margin. Lead companies charge $50 to $300 per name, often reselling the same “hot” lead to five or more agents at once (see examples in 12 Real Estate Lead Generation Strategies). Lead companies charge $50 to $300 per name, often reselling the same “hot” lead to five or more agents at once. Conversion rates hover around 1–2%, meaning 98% of your time and money evaporate into thin air.

It’s a treadmill disguised as progress: to maintain income, you must keep paying. Miss one month, and your lead flow stops cold. There’s no equity, no residual value, and no future income once the spending ends. Lead providers design it this way; they want you dependent enough to stay subscribed forever.

Take it from Mauricio, one of our team members, who says that he built his business around consistency, not dependency. Adding just five people a day to his database turned into 50+ closings a year—no paid leads required.”

Think of it like renting farmland: you pay for every harvest but never own the soil. You’re feeding someone else’s empire while hoping they’ll keep giving you access to the crops. Meanwhile, agents who own their databases are building generational wealth from their own fields.

The Value of Owning Your Pipeline

Owning your real estate pipeline means controlling lead flow through your own database, systems, and content rather than paying third-party providers. Owned pipelines generate higher-quality leads, consistent referrals, and long-term business equity you can grow or sell.

When you own your pipeline, every contact you collect becomes an appreciating asset, one that keeps paying dividends through repeat and referral business. Unlike rented leads that vanish the moment you stop paying, owned databases compound in value as your relationships grow stronger.

Here’s the math traditional brokerages don’t teach: a $3,000 monthly lead budget equals $36,000 a year, money that disappears with no residual value. Put that same effort into building a CRM-driven pipeline, and you create an asset that delivers leads for decades. Every past client becomes a future closing, every email sequence a digital salesperson working 24/7.

Owned pipelines also mean freedom from competition. You’re not racing to call a lead five seconds faster than ten other agents. You’re communicating with people who already know, like, and trust you. These are clients who choose you because you’ve built authority and familiarity over time.

Jessica, another team member, built a $300K GCI business by focusing on ownership, not panic. Once she started building her own audience, her database became both her safety net and her retirement plan. No more worrying about where the next deal would come from.

And let’s be honest, owning your pipeline feels good. It’s like finally buying your dream home after years of renting apartments with mystery stains and thin walls. You’re no longer at the mercy of someone else’s system. You own the foundation, the roof, and the mailbox where all the good referrals show up.

How eXp Realty Supports Pipeline Ownership

eXp Realty supports pipeline ownership through built-in technology, CRM tools, and global referral networks that help agents build sustainable lead systems they control (see eXp’s “My Link My Lead” tool). The model empowers agents to create repeat and referral business instead of relying on purchased leads.

Most brokerages talk about “support,” but what they really mean is “you’re on your own with a desk fee.” eXp Realty actually delivers tools that make ownership possible. Every agent starts with a CRM choice (BoldTrail, Lofty, or Cloze) CRM, access to top training for getting your own leads, and easy referral tools. All is already included in the $85 monthly brokerage fee. That’s your digital command center for nurturing leads, automating follow-ups, and tracking your database from anywhere.

The secret sauce? eXp’s model rewards ownership at every level. Agents who help others build pipelines share in the company’s revenue through revenue share, and just doing deals earns EXPI stock awards, real equity in the brokerage itself. This alignment creates a culture of collaboration, not competition. And, that’s very different then your local brokerage office, where agents may share a bit of good information but they hide the best tips.

Ken H. knows a thing or two about scale. His team closes over 900 deals a year. When he rebuilt his business with eXp’s CRM and systems, he stopped chasing leads and started owning them. Now every process runs itself, and his pipeline basically refuses to take a day off. 

In short, eXp Realty gives you the tools to own your pipeline instead of leasing someone else’s. Think of it like moving from paying rent to joining a co-op: you’re not just using the system, you’re profiting from it.

The Payoff: Freedom from Lead Dependency

Freedom from lead dependency allows real estate agents to generate consistent business without relying on paid lead providers. Owning your database creates predictable income, higher ROI, and long-term stability that grows even when marketing budgets shrink.

When agents stop renting leads and start owning their pipeline, everything changes. Stress drops, costs shrink, and business becomes predictable again. Instead of gambling $5,000 a month hoping for a few conversions, you’re running a system that compounds. Your CRM turns into a gold mine and each conversation today becomes tomorrow’s closing.

Agents who shift to ownership see the difference almost immediately. The first few months save thousands in expenses. Within a year, referrals and repeat clients replace cold prospects entirely. And by year three, you’ve built a self-sustaining lead engine that generates income even when you’re not prospecting daily.

That’s the real definition of leverage: your time and relationships working for you. Owned pipelines convert at 5–10x higher rates, cost pennies to maintain, and build business equity that can be sold or passed on later. Lead renters keep hustling for the next batch of internet strangers; pipeline owners wake up to new opportunities already in their inbox.

Marsha, a team member closing over $100,000 annually, decided burnout wasn’t a business plan. Two years after ditching paid leads, her pipeline still grows on autopilot. Every repeat client and referral feels like a bonus check from past effort. The best part? She’s doing it all on a four-day workweek 

Owning your lead system is the business equivalent of planting fruit trees instead of buying fruit. The first harvest takes effort, but once it starts producing, it never stops. And best of all? You never have to worry about someone else turning off your water supply.

What Agents Also Ask About Lead Generation

How long does it take to replace paid leads with owned ones?
Most agents replace paid-lead volume within 90–120 days by using CRM automation and consistent follow-up. Owned pipelines grow faster because you’re nurturing real relationships instead of buying cold names. The more conversations you start, the sooner momentum compounds.

Do I need a big audience to build an owned pipeline?
No. A strong real estate database beats a large social following every time. Even 100 engaged contacts can produce repeat and referral business if you stay consistent. Focus on connection and follow-up, not follower count.

Can I mix purchased and owned leads during the transition?
Absolutely. Many agents maintain short-term paid sources while their owned systems mature, using insights from lead management platforms like Pipeline ROI to segment and nurture contacts.

Why do owned pipelines convert better?
Because trust compounds. Leads from your own database already recognize your brand, communication style, and expertise. That familiarity increases response rates and reduces churn, often delivering 5–10x higher conversion than rented leads.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Choosing your sponsor when joining eXp Realty isn’t just a formality, it determines whether you start from scratch or plug straight into a complete business ecosystem. When you join Smart Agent Alliance, you don’t just gain a sponsor, you gain an entire infrastructure designed to help you own your pipeline from day one.

While most agents spend years piecing together systems, Smart Agent Alliance hands you a ready-to-run operation worth $7,000+ per year, completely free with sponsorship. Every bundle eliminates a major pain point that keeps agents dependent on expensive leads or disorganized marketing:

These aren’t theoretical “resources” buried in a backend folder. These are built, launched, and running the day you join. Systems attract leads 24/7, AI follows up automatically, and masterminds keep you improving weekly alongside top producers.

Choosing Smart Agent Alliance means never wondering where your next lead will come from. It’s the shortcut to owning your pipeline and your business future.

? Visit Smart Agent Alliance to see the full sponsorship details and start building your owned lead system today. Get more information about experienced agent problems and solutions here.

Frequently Asked Questions

How long does it take to replace purchased leads with an owned pipeline?

Agents who follow a structured CRM and nurture plan often replace their paid-lead volume within 90 to 120 days. Consistent outreach, follow-up automation, and database segmentation accelerate the transition from dependency to predictable organic lead flow.

What if I don’t have a database to start with?

Begin by importing past contacts, social media connections, and open-house visitors into a CRM. Then add new leads from website forms, social content, and referral sources. Over time, each contact becomes part of a self-sustaining lead ecosystem you control completely.

Do owned pipelines require more work than buying leads?

Initial setup takes effort, but automation handles most ongoing communication. Once your systems are live, owned pipelines require less time than managing paid-lead platforms while producing higher-quality conversations and more reliable conversion results.

How much should I budget for building an owned pipeline?

At eXp Realty, all essential tools, CRM, marketing automation, and cloud support, are included in the standard $85 monthly fee. Agents who join Smart Agent Alliance receive additional free systems worth over $7,000 annually, making pipeline ownership nearly cost-free.

Can I still use purchased leads while I build an owned system?

Yes. Many agents run both concurrently. The key is to transfer purchased leads into your CRM, tag them properly, and nurture them through your own sequences. This turns rented contacts into owned relationships that strengthen your long-term database.

What’s the biggest mistake agents make when building a pipeline?

Neglecting consistent follow-up. Most leads convert after multiple touches, not one. A CRM with automation and reminders ensures no contact slips through the cracks, protecting both your pipeline and your income.

Why So Many Realtors Burn Out

It’s designed for experienced producers who already perform well but want systems to scale. The focus is automation, leadership, and long-term growth, not beginner scripts or transaction basics.

What kind of mentorship do agents actually get?
Agents work directly with mentors like Doug Smart and Karrie Hill and participate in private masterminds with top Wolf Pack producers. The mentorship is hands-on and strategic, helping agents execute, not just learn.

Can I keep my own systems and branding?
Yes. Smart Agent Alliance systems integrate with existing CRMs, automations, and marketing platforms. You can keep your brand and add SAA’s systems for leverage. What agents value most isn’t hype: it’s clarity. Smart Agent Alliance gives that clarity, turning the mystery of scaling into a mapped process that finally makes sense.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Choosing a sponsor at eXp Realty can shape everything: your systems, your mentorship, and your long-term results. Smart Agent Alliance ensures experienced agents get both immediate leverage and lasting growth support through a dual ecosystem built for scalability. And, you must make this important decision when you join eXp.

You don’t need to buy more courses or bolt together random tools. The structure is already built. Every automation, every training, every mastermind connects from day one so you can focus on production instead of piecing things together.

The right sponsor is also your insurance policy against stagnation. At eXp, independence is a gift but without the right guidance, it can feel like isolation. Smart Agent Alliance gives you the blueprint, the tools, and the people to make independence profitable, not lonely.

It also matters because what you learn here compounds. You’ll gain systems that work today, mentorship that grows with you, and an environment where sharing success isn’t optional; it’s the culture. Agents who align with Smart Agent Alliance don’t just plug in. They level up.

Skipping this step, joining without the right sponsor, means starting from scratch. With SAA, you begin with leverage already in place. It’s the difference between walking into a turn-key business or a blank office with a folding chair. One gets you momentum on day one. The other just gets you echoes. Get more information about experienced agent problems and solutions here.

Frequently Asked Questions

What makes Smart Agent Alliance different from other eXp teams?

Smart Agent Alliance merges two proven leadership networks, offering advanced systems, automation, and mentorship worth over $7,000 annually, all included free with sponsorship.

Do I need to pay extra for Smart Agent Alliance programs?

No. All systems, courses, and masterminds are included with sponsorship. You only maintain your standard eXp Realty account and $85 monthly brokerage fee.

Is Smart Agent Alliance available in every eXp market?

Yes. The SAA and Wolf Pack support networks operate globally under eXp Realty, providing full access to all members regardless of location.

How soon can I access the systems after joining?

You’ll receive onboarding instructions within 24–48 hours of eXp Realty sponsorship approval. Tools and training unlock immediately upon confirmation.

title: Why Mentoring Feels Thankless (and How eXp Rewards It)
excerpt: Key Takeaway: Traditional brokerages rely on free mentoring. eXp Realty pays mentors, rewards leadership, and builds a culture where helping others creates income, recognition, and…
content:
Key Takeaway: Traditional brokerages rely on free mentoring. eXp Realty pays mentors, rewards leadership, and builds a culture where helping others creates income, recognition, and long-term wealth.

TL;DR About Mentoring Rewards

• Mentoring isn’t rewarded at most brokerages.
• eXp offers three structured mentorship paths.
• Certified mentors earn from mentees’ first deals.
• Sponsors and ICON agents share leadership company-wide.
• Smart Agent Alliance adds automation that makes mentoring effortless.

If you’ve ever been the “go-to” agent in your office, you already know the secret cost of generosity. You spend hours walking new agents through listings, marketing, and contracts while your brokerage collects the profits. The thank-you cards are nice, but they don’t cover closing costs.

At many brokerages, mentoring isn’t rewarded at all. It’s simply expected. You train your future competition, your production stalls, and your reward is usually a pat on the back at the next team meeting. Over time, the agents most qualified to teach stop volunteering altogether, leaving new agents to struggle and the culture to stagnate.

eXp Realty changes that equation. Instead of extracting free training, it rewards it. The model values your time, expertise, and leadership by building mentorship into the business structure itself through income, recognition, and real ownership.

Table of Contents

The Three Types of Mentorship at eXp Realty (and Why They Matter)

1. Certified Mentorship Program
2. Sponsor Mentorship
3. ICON Mentorship and eXp University
The Hidden Cost of Being a Mentor
Why Recognition and Rewards Change Everything
The Payoff: Mentorship That Builds Real Wealth
What Agents Also Ask About Mentoring Rewards
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Smart Agent Alliance Free Value Stack 
Frequently Asked Questions

The Three Types of Mentorship at eXp Realty (and Why They Matter)

eXp Realty offers three main types of mentorship: certified mentor programs for new agents, sponsor-led mentorship from supporting uplines, and ICON agent mentorship through eXp University. Each type rewards leadership differently, combining income, recognition, and shared expertise to create a culture where everyone grows together.

1. Certified Mentorship Program

Any experienced agent at eXp can apply to become an eXp Certified Mentor. Once approved, mentors are paired with new licensees for their first three transactions and earn a 10% mentor fee on each. It’s structured, transparent, and ensures mentors are compensated for the real work of developing others. New agents get guidance from vetted experts instead of guessing their way through deals, and mentors gain both income and influence.

2. Sponsor Mentorship

Every agent who joins eXp names a sponsor, the person who introduced or guided them into the company. Most sponsors stop there. But the best, like Smart Agent Alliance, go further by offering systems, one-on-one coaching, and automated onboarding that rival full brokerage training programs.

Sponsor mentorship turns leadership into leverage by helping agents scale through shared systems and collective growth. Sponsors who provide this level of support are rewarded through company-paid revenue share, earned on each transaction their sponsored agents close until they cap each year. This ensures that leaders who invest time in others are compensated for the success they help create.

3. ICON Mentorship and eXp University

eXp’s culture of mentorship doesn’t stop at the team level. Top producers recognized as ICON Agents give back through live classes, panels, and recorded sessions inside eXp University. These are current, actionable strategies from agents closing at the top of today’s market.

ICON agents are paid for that contribution. Teaching through eXp University helps them earn their full company cap back in EXPI stock. Sharing knowledge isn’t charity; it’s part of the performance criteria that rewards leadership with ownership.

Together, these three layers create something rare in real estate: a mentorship ecosystem that actually rewards contribution. You can teach, lead, and inspire without sacrificing your own business to do it.

But to understand why that matters, we have to talk about what most brokerages would rather not: the cost of mentoring where recognition is missing.

The Hidden Cost of Being a Mentor

At traditional brokerages, mentorship quietly drains the very people keeping the company afloat. Experienced agents train newcomers for free while brokers collect the profits. The result is burnout, turnover, and lost expertise. eXp Realty flips this by paying mentors and honoring leadership instead of exploiting it.

In most firms, mentoring is treated like a moral obligation, not a professional contribution. You’re expected to train new agents simply because you’ve survived long enough to know what you’re doing. Hours disappear into helping others draft offers, troubleshoot transactions, or figure out which CRM button does what. Meanwhile, your own production and paycheck take the hit.

The brokerage profits twice: once from your deals and again from the agents you helped make productive. You, on the other hand, get a handshake and a new round of “quick questions.”

That drain is the hidden cost of being a mentor. It doesn’t show up on a profit-and-loss sheet, but it shows up in fatigue, lost focus, and slower growth. Many seasoned agents stop mentoring, not because they don’t want to help, but because they can’t afford to.

At eXp Realty, that cost isn’t hidden. It’s acknowledged, structured, and paid. Whether through certified mentor fees, sponsor revenue share, or ICON stock awards, the company puts real value behind the act of helping others succeed. The culture doesn’t just say “thank you.” It writes it into your income statement.

Jenna M. spent years at a boutique brokerage constantly helping the new ones without compensation. When she joined eXp Realty, she became a Certified Mentor and immediately saw the difference. She says she now gets paid for what I was already doing for free. Her mentees learn faster, her time feels respected, and her income grew by $2,000 a month from mentorship alone. 

Traditional mentoring is like giving away your best recipes while someone else sells the cookbook. At eXp, you own the copyright. You still help others, but now every page you share adds to your portfolio. That’s not just better business; it’s fair business.

Why Recognition and Rewards Change Everything

When mentoring is recognized and rewarded, it transforms from obligation to opportunity. eXp Realty’s structure doesn’t just pay mentors; it builds leaders. Recognition creates purpose, deepens collaboration, and keeps experienced agents engaged long after others would burn out.

Recognition does more than add income; it restores purpose. Most agents don’t stop mentoring because they dislike helping people. They stop because no one notices. eXp fixes that by making development visible and celebrated.

Mentors see their effort reflected in both their income and their influence. Certified mentors are acknowledged in eXp University. Sponsors are recognized within their networks for building talent. ICON agents are celebrated company-wide for contributing to the culture. That visibility reinforces the idea that leadership is part of production, not separate from it.

The result? Stronger teams, faster growth, and better retention. People stay where their work matters and their leadership multiplies. Recognition fuels momentum, and at eXp, that momentum compounds into legacy.

Aaron P. joined eXp after realizing his old brokerage rewarded isolation, not collaboration. At eXp, he began mentoring agents he sponsored, helping them build scalable systems. He says it’s not just about signing people; it’s about setting them up to win. His leadership now generates consistent revenue share, and his team has a 90% retention rate.

Recognition is the oxygen of growth. At eXp, mentors don’t fade into the background, they become the reason the room keeps breathing.

The Payoff: Mentorship That Builds Real Wealth

At eXp Realty, mentoring isn’t a side task. It’s a wealth strategy. Income from mentoring, revenue share, and stock growth can surpass traditional sales income, especially when paired with Smart Agent Alliance’s revenue sharing automation and value stack.

The long-term payoff of mentoring at eXp is leverage. Most agents chase commissions that reset every January. Mentors, with revenue share, can build something that pays beyond the next closing. Every person you help succeed adds another stream to your financial ecosystem. This is income that grows as others grow.

Smart Agent Alliance takes that further. Its systems handle making and hosting agent attraction webpages, doing webinars and 1on1 calls and providing automated recruiting follow-up, allowing team member mentors to scale without adding hours. Combined with eXp’s built-in rewards, mentorship becomes the bridge between active income and lasting wealth.

Each mentee who grows eventually mentors others, expanding the network that began with your leadership. Simple guidance turns into compounding results—financially and professionally.

Nicole T. joined eXp after attending an ICON Agent training inside eXp University. She recounts that it was the first time she saw top producers actually sharing their playbook. She later built her own mentorship circle using what she learned from those classes. Her team doubled its production within a year, and she’s now working toward ICON herself.

At most brokerages, mentoring ends when the applause dies down. At eXp, and especially inside Smart Agent Alliance, it’s just getting started.

What Agents Also Ask About Mentoring Rewards

How does mentoring actually work at eXp Realty?
eXp Realty offers three mentorship paths. Certified mentors earn 10% on a new agent’s first three deals, sponsors can mentor and earn company-paid revenue share, and ICON agents teach through eXp University while earning stock awards. Mentorship is structured, recognized, and financially rewarding.

Do all sponsors at eXp provide mentorship?
No. Every eXp agent can name a sponsor, but only some provide ongoing systems and training. Sponsors in Smart Agent Alliance go beyond introductions by offering onboarding and automation that make mentorship scalable.

Can mentors at eXp make real income from mentoring?
Yes. Certified mentors receive a 10% mentor fee on their mentees’ first three transactions. Sponsors earn company-paid revenue share from each closing their sponsored agents complete until they cap each year. Combined, mentorship income can reach thousands monthly.

What’s the difference between mentoring and recruiting at eXp?
Recruiting invites agents to join eXp. Mentoring develops their success once they’re in. eXp rewards both, but mentorship drives retention, performance, and long-term income. Smart Agent Alliance emphasizes mentorship first because growth sticks when agents win.

Why is eXp’s mentoring culture different from other brokerages?
Most brokerages expect unpaid training from senior agents. eXp pays for it, celebrates it, and scales it through eXp University and sponsor mentorship. Mentors aren’t drained—they’re rewarded for strengthening the company.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

When you fill out your eXp Realty application, you’ll be asked to name a sponsor defined as the person who brought you into the company. That single choice determines the mentorship, systems, and support you’ll have from day one. It’s not a ceremonial line on a form. It’s often the foundation of your success.

Choose a sponsor who offers more than a welcome call. With Smart Agent Alliance, you don’t just get mentorship, you get a full business-building infrastructure that automates and accelerates everything eXp already provides. It’s how mentoring turns into measurable income instead of extra work.

Smart Agent Alliance Free Value Stack 

  1. Social Agent Academy Pro – $997/year
    Learn to attract clients and agents organically using proven social and video strategies.
  2. AI Agent Accelerator – $697
    Automate marketing and follow-up with custom AI tools.
  3. Client Pipeline Accelerator – $2,497 value
    Keep your pipeline full with automated CRM systems.
  4. Top Agent Live Masterminds – Not available for sale
    Five weekly mastermind calls with top eXp and Wolf Pack leaders.
  5. Done-For-You Extra Income System – $2,363–$10,000+/year
    Complete agent attraction and nurture system built for you.
  6. Brand New Agent Accelerator – $497 value
    Plug-and-play onboarding program that trains new team members automatically.

Total Combined Value: $7,000+ per year and all free when you join through Smart Agent Alliance.

Together, eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance make mentorship both profitable and sustainable. eXp provides the framework; SAA provides the systems that scale it.

Visit Smart Agent Alliance for full details and discover how leadership becomes wealth-building when powered by automation, collaboration, and the right sponsor. Get more information about experienced agent problems and solutions here.

Frequently Asked Questions

How much do certified mentors at eXp Realty earn?

Certified mentors earn 10% of their mentee’s gross commission income on the first three closed transactions. This payment comes from eXp’s company dollar, not the mentee’s portion, ensuring mentors are compensated for providing structured guidance.

What is the difference between a sponsor and a certified mentor at eXp?

A sponsor is the person an agent names when joining eXp Realty, while a certified mentor is formally assigned to train new agents. Sponsors may mentor voluntarily, but certified mentors are approved by eXp and paid through the official program.

Do ICON agents at eXp Realty get paid for mentoring?

Yes. ICON agents teach and mentor through eXp University as part of earning their cap back in EXPI stock, tying company recognition directly to agent education.

Can I choose my own mentor at eXp Realty?

New agents are assigned a certified mentor by eXp Realty, typically within their market, to guide them through their first three transactions. Additional mentorship can also come from sponsors or team leaders who choose to provide it.

Does every eXp sponsor provide mentorship?

No. Mentorship is optional for sponsors. Some only make introductions, while others provide full systems and accountability. Sponsors like Smart Agent Alliance offer structured mentorship with automation that supports both new and seasoned agents.

Can I become a certified mentor at eXp Realty?

Yes. Experienced agents who meet eXp’s criteria can apply for certifications. Once approved, they receive training and begin mentoring new agents, earning 10% of their mentees’ first three commissions.
